topic: Image processing with convolution kernels

interaction_forms.label: Pixel Inspection
interaction_forms.description: Hovering over a pixel in either the input or output image highlights the corresponding 3x3 pixel block in the input image and the kernel values, showing the calculation that produces the output pixel's value.

interaction_forms.label: Kernel Selection
interaction_forms.description: Selecting a different kernel type from the provided list changes the values in the 3x3 kernel matrix, which updates the output image with the corresponding visual effect.

interaction_forms.label: Custom Kernel Editing
interaction_forms.description: Users can directly edit the numerical values within the 3x3 kernel matrix when the 'custom' kernel is selected, which dynamically updates the output image to reflect the custom filter.

interaction_forms.label: Image Upload
interaction_forms.description: Uploading a custom image replaces the default image as the input for the kernel convolution.

interaction_forms.label: Live Video Input
interaction_forms.description: Activating the live video feed uses the webcam stream as the real-time input image for the kernel operations.

topic: The definition of Pi as the ratio of circumference to diameter

interaction_forms.label: Wrap Size
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the slider adjusts the circle's diameter, which proportionally changes the circumference, while the calculated ratio of circumference to diameter remains constant.

topic: Exponential growth as repeated multiplication

interaction_forms.label: Change Growth Factor
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'x2', 'x3', or 'x4' buttons sets the multiplication factor for each step in the exponential growth visualization.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust Animation Steps
interaction_forms.description: A slider labeled 'steps' controls the number of discrete growth intervals shown in the animation.

interaction_forms.label: Control Animation Speed
interaction_forms.description: A slider labeled 'speed' adjusts the playback speed of the visualization's animation.

interaction_forms.label: Restart Animation
interaction_forms.description: A 'Restart' button replays the current growth animation from the beginning.

topic: Euclidean geometric constructions with compass and straightedge.

interaction_forms.label: Select Tool
interaction_forms.description: Clicking an icon from the tool palette selects a geometric construction tool, such as a line, circle, or point.

interaction_forms.label: Define Construction
interaction_forms.description: Clicking on points or existing geometric objects on the canvas defines the parameters for the selected tool, causing a new object to be drawn.

interaction_forms.label: Advance Level
interaction_forms.description: When the constructed geometric objects satisfy the goal conditions for the current level, the game automatically validates the solution and proceeds to the next challenge.

topic: The Mandelbrot set's generation from iterating a function on complex numbers.

interaction_forms.label: Repositioning a complex number
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the flag marker repositions a point on the complex plane, causing the visualization to recalculate and redraw the resulting path of the iterated function.

interaction_forms.label: Controlling iteration steps
interaction_forms.description: Moving the step slider sets the number of function iterations to perform, which animates the visualized path of the point from its origin to the selected step count.

interaction_forms.label: Drawing the set
interaction_forms.description: In specific demonstrations, dragging the flag marker over the canvas calculates whether each point is in the set and colors the pixel accordingly, allowing the user to scribble the fractal into existence.

interaction_forms.label: Zooming the view
interaction_forms.description: Clicking on the main fractal visualization zooms into that point, while middle-clicking zooms out to reveal a wider view.

interaction_forms.label: Resetting the view
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the "Reset zoom" button returns the fractal visualization to its original default position and magnification level.

topic: Mathematical definition and geometric construction of Bézier curves

interaction_forms.label: Draggable Points
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the start, end, or control points modifies the shape of the Bézier curve and updates any associated visualizations like component functions, bounding boxes, or derivatives.

interaction_forms.label: Slider / Parameter Control
interaction_forms.description: Adjusting a slider changes a specific parameter, such as the interpolation value 't', rational weights, or the number of approximation segments, which dynamically updates the visualization.

interaction_forms.label: Keyboard Input
interaction_forms.description: Pressing the up and down arrow keys increments or decrements a parameter, such as the interpolation ratio, curve order, or the number of segments used in a curve approximation.

interaction_forms.label: Cursor Position Tracking
interaction_forms.description: Moving the mouse cursor over a graphic provides real-time input to project the cursor's location onto the curve or to select a parameter value based on horizontal position.

interaction_forms.label: Algorithmic Step-through
interaction_forms.description: Clicking a button advances an algorithm by a single step, such as iterating through the recursive subdivision process for finding curve intersections.

interaction_forms.label: Point Creation
interaction_forms.description: Clicking on the background of a visualization adds a new data point, which is then used to recalculate and update a curve fitted to the set of points.

interaction_forms.label: Direct Curve Manipulation (Molding)
interaction_forms.description: Clicking and dragging a point on the curve itself reshapes it in real-time as the system continuously recalculates the underlying control points to make the curve pass through the cursor's current position.

topic: Fourier decomposition of signals

interaction_forms.label: Select Signal Type
interaction_forms.description: Selecting a signal from the dropdown menu (e.g., Triangle, Sawtooth, Square) updates the visualization to show the specific combination of rotating circles required to generate that waveform.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust Series Terms
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the 'Terms' slider changes the number of circles and corresponding sine waves used in the Fourier series, altering the accuracy of the approximation to the target signal.

interaction_forms.label: Control Time
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the time slider scrubs the animation forwards or backwards, showing the circular paths and the resulting signal being drawn over time.

interaction_forms.label: Draw Custom Signal
interaction_forms.description: Switching to the 'drawing' tab allows the user to draw a custom periodic function with the mouse, which the visualizer then automatically decomposes into its constituent Fourier series circles.

topic: Conditional probability and sample space

interaction_forms.label: Filter by Event
interaction_forms.description: Clicking on the buttons for event 'A' or 'B' filters the population to only include outcomes where that event occurred, updating the probabilities to be conditional on that event.

interaction_forms.label: Change Perspective
interaction_forms.description: Switching between the 'P(B|A)' and 'P(A|B)' perspectives rearranges the visualization to illustrate the calculation for each respective conditional probability.

interaction_forms.label: View World Population
interaction_forms.description: Selecting the 'world' view removes all conditions, showing the entire sample space and the unconditional probabilities of each event.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust Frequencies
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the handles on the 'drop frequency' chart changes the base probabilities of events A and B, which dynamically updates the entire visualization.

topic: Parameter sensitivity of histograms

interaction_forms.label: Select dataset
interaction_forms.description: Buttons allow switching between multiple sample datasets to observe how parameter choices affect different data distributions.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust bin offset (slider)
interaction_forms.description: A slider continuously shifts the bin boundaries horizontally along the number line, which redistributes data points and alters the resulting bin counts.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust bin width (slider)
interaction_forms.description: A slider continuously adjusts the width of all bins simultaneously, changing the number of bins and the granularity of the data summary.

interaction_forms.label: Select parameter value (discrete)
interaction_forms.description: Users can click on specific predefined numerical values for bin width or offset to directly set that parameter.

interaction_forms.label: Toggle parameter sweep
interaction_forms.description: A button overlays a semi-transparent 'cloud' of all possible histograms generated by sweeping through a range of values for a given parameter.

interaction_forms.label: Toggle density plot
interaction_forms.description: A checkbox switches the vertical axis from representing raw counts to representing density, which normalizes bin heights by their width.

interaction_forms.label: Switch bin openness
interaction_forms.description: A toggle switches between left-open and right-open bins, changing how data points that fall exactly on a boundary are assigned to a bin.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust bin offset (drag)
interaction_forms.description: Directly dragging the histogram bars horizontally adjusts the bin offset, leaving a faint trail of previous histogram shapes to show the history of changes.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust bin width (drag)
interaction_forms.description: A dedicated handle can be dragged horizontally to directly manipulate and change the width of the histogram bins.

topic: Predictability of human-generated binary sequences

interaction_forms.label: Select Binary Choice
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'Zero' or 'One' buttons or pressing the corresponding keyboard keys submits a choice, prompting the machine to make its own prediction and updating the game's score.

interaction_forms.label: Reset Game
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'Reset' button or pressing the 'Space' key on the keyboard clears the history of choices and resets the scores to zero.

topic: The frequentist interpretation of confidence intervals and their relationship to a population parameter.

interaction_forms.label: Draw Samples Slider
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the slider initiates a simulation that repeatedly draws samples, calculates and plots their confidence intervals, and updates a running tally of how many intervals contain the true population mean.

interaction_forms.label: Confidence Level Slider
interaction_forms.description: Adjusting the slider changes the confidence level, which immediately alters the width of the calculated confidence intervals in the visualization.

interaction_forms.label: Sample Size Control
interaction_forms.description: Increasing or decreasing the sample size for each draw results in narrower or wider confidence intervals, respectively, for all subsequent samples.

interaction_forms.label: Simulation Speed Control
interaction_forms.description: The speed of the simulation is increased or decreased by clicking the respective buttons, controlling the rate at which new sample confidence intervals are generated and displayed.

interaction_forms.label: Pause Button
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the button toggles the simulation between a paused and running state, halting or resuming the continuous drawing of new samples.

topic: Probabilistic state transitions in Markov chains

interaction_forms.label: Edit Transition Matrix
interaction_forms.description: Clicking a cell within the transition matrix allows for editing its numerical probability value, which visually updates the thickness of the corresponding arrows in the state graph.

interaction_forms.label: Reposition Nodes
interaction_forms.description: Clicking and dragging the nodes (states) in the graph visualization repositions them to alter the visual layout without affecting the transition logic.

interaction_forms.label: Control Simulation Speed
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the 'speed' slider to the left or right increases or decreases the rate at which the random walk simulation transitions between states.

interaction_forms.label: Load Examples
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'ex1', 'ex2', 'ex3', or 'randomly' links loads different pre-configured transition matrices and corresponding state graph visualizations.

interaction_forms.label: Edit Model via Text
interaction_forms.description: Directly editing the text representation of the transition matrix allows for adding, removing, or renaming states and probabilities, which regenerates the entire model and visualization.

topic: Ordinary Least Squares regression

interaction_forms.label: Move Data Points
interaction_forms.description: Dragging any data point on the 2D scatter plot causes the regression line and the beta coefficients in the associated equation to update in real-time.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust Beta Coefficients
interaction_forms.description: Manipulating the interactive dials for the line's intercept and slope changes the regression line's position and resizes the corresponding squares that visualize the error for each point.

interaction_forms.label: Move 3D Data Points
interaction_forms.description: Dragging a data point in either of the two scatter plots for the two independent variables updates its position in both plots and re-calculates the 3D regression plane to fit the new data.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust 3D Beta Coefficients
interaction_forms.description: Adjusting the three beta coefficient dials modifies the regression plane's equation and its orientation, which is shown as two separate lines on the 2D scatter plots.

topic: Principal components analysis for dimensionality reduction

interaction_forms.label: Repositioning data points
interaction_forms.description: Dragging points in the 2D scatter plot causes the principal component axes to re-calculate and rotate in real-time while updating the corresponding 1D and 2D projections of the data.

interaction_forms.label: Rotating the data cloud
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the 3D scatter plot rotates the data cloud, allowing the user to view the data from different angles and perspectives.

interaction_forms.label: Projecting onto principal components
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'Show PCA' button automatically rotates the 3D data to the optimal viewpoint along its first two principal components.

interaction_forms.label: Resetting the view
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'reset' button returns the 3D data visualization to its original, default orientation.

topic: Probabilistic life expectancy and mortality rates based on current age and sex.

interaction_forms.label: Select Sex
interaction_forms.description: Choosing a demographic group (female or male) changes the underlying mortality data, which recalculates and re-simulates the probabilities of remaining lifespan.

interaction_forms.label: Enter Age
interaction_forms.description: Inputting a number for current age sets the starting point for the simulation, which then visualizes the distribution of possible remaining years of life.

interaction_forms.label: Toggle Simulation Speed
interaction_forms.description: Switching between 'Slow' and 'Fast' modes alters the speed at which the simulation runs and the corresponding visualization unfolds.

topic: Eigenvectors and eigenvalues of a linear transformation.

interaction_forms.label: Modify Transformation Matrix
interaction_forms.description: Editing the values of the 2x2 matrix adjusts the linear transformation, causing the transformed vector, grid lines, and calculated eigenspaces to update.

interaction_forms.label: Drag Vector
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the vector on the 2D plane changes its components, and the transformed vector simultaneously updates to show the result of the matrix multiplication.

topic: Geometric interpretation of 2x2 matrix transformations.

interaction_forms.label: Vector Manipulation
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the basis vectors î and ĵ updates the matrix values and transforms the grid space.

interaction_forms.label: Direct Matrix Input
interaction_forms.description: Typing numbers into the 2x2 matrix cells applies the corresponding linear transformation to the grid.

interaction_forms.label: Preset Transformations
interaction_forms.description: Clicking buttons for predefined transformations like 'Scale,' 'Shear,' or 'Rotate' instantly applies them to the matrix and the grid.

interaction_forms.label: Drawing Custom Shapes
interaction_forms.description: Drawing a shape on the input grid renders the same shape on the output grid after being modified by the current matrix transformation.

interaction_forms.label: Determinant Visualization
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the determinant value animates the transformation of the unit square to visually represent how its area changes.

interaction_forms.label: Matrix Transposition
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'Transpose' button swaps the matrix's non-diagonal elements and updates the grid to the new transformation.

interaction_forms.label: Matrix Inversion
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'Inverse' button calculates and applies the inverse transformation to the matrix and grid, visually undoing the current transformation.

interaction_forms.label: Sequential Transformations
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the combined transformation examples at the bottom applies a sequence of two transformations to the matrix and the grid.

topic: Dimensionality reduction of high-dimensional vectors for visualization

interaction_forms.label: Select dataset
interaction_forms.description: Choosing a dataset from a dropdown menu updates the scatter plot to show the corresponding embeddings.

interaction_forms.label: Select algorithm
interaction_forms.description: Selecting a dimensionality reduction algorithm (PCA, t-SNE, or UMAP) recalculates and animates the transition of the data points to their new positions in the 2D space.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust algorithm parameters
interaction_forms.description: Modifying sliders for algorithm-specific parameters, such as perplexity or number of neighbors, causes the visualization to re-compute and update the embedding projection.

interaction_forms.label: Hover over data points
interaction_forms.description: Moving the cursor over a point in the scatter plot highlights it and displays a tooltip with its corresponding label or metadata.

topic: Signal decomposition into sinusoidal components

interaction_forms.label: Signal Type
interaction_forms.description: Selecting a new signal type from the dropdown menu changes the target signal being decomposed and visualized.

interaction_forms.label: Number of Sinusoids
interaction_forms.description: Adjusting the slider changes the number of sine waves used in the reconstruction, altering the fidelity of the resulting composite signal.

interaction_forms.label: Frequency
interaction_forms.description: Modifying the slider adjusts the fundamental frequency of the selected signal.

interaction_forms.label: Play Audio
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the play button generates and plays the sound of the currently visualized waveform.

topic: The effect of 2x2 matrix transformations on a 2D vector space.

interaction_forms.label: Matrix element sliders
interaction_forms.description: Adjusting the four sliders directly modifies the individual elements of the 2x2 transformation matrix, which visually updates the transformed grid and output vector.

interaction_forms.label: Preset matrix selector
interaction_forms.description: Selecting a transformation type from the dropdown menu, such as 'Shear' or 'Rotation', automatically sets the matrix element sliders to the corresponding preset values.

interaction_forms.label: Draggable input vector
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the head of the input vector 'v' in the 'Before' plot changes its components, and the 'After' plot simultaneously updates to show the new transformed vector 'Av'.

topic: Generation of Julia set fractals through the iteration of complex functions.

interaction_forms.label: Scroll-driven Slideshow
interaction_forms.description: Scrolling the page progresses through a sequence of narrative steps, each accompanied by a synchronized animation or visualization.

interaction_forms.label: Animation Controls
interaction_forms.description: Clicking on 'Previous/Next Slide' buttons navigates between animated steps, while 'Repeat Animation' replays the current visual sequence.

interaction_forms.label: Draggable Complex Numbers
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the endpoints of two vectors on the complex plane dynamically updates a third vector representing their geometric product.

interaction_forms.label: Power Slider
interaction_forms.description: Adjusting a slider changes the exponent of a complex power function, causing the visualization of the complex plane to fold or unfold in real-time.

interaction_forms.label: Draggable Julia Constant
interaction_forms.description: Dragging a point representing the constant 'c' on the complex plane interactively morphs the shape of the corresponding Julia set fractal.

interaction_forms.label: Pan and Zoom Fractal Map
interaction_forms.description: Clicking and dragging or scrolling within the Mandelbrot set view pans and zooms into its structure, which simultaneously updates the corresponding Julia set visualization.

topic: The relationship between the unit circle and the sine and cosine functions.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust Angle
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the point on the unit circle changes the angle, which updates the visual representation of the right triangle and the calculated sine and cosine values.

interaction_forms.label: Resize Triangle
interaction_forms.description: A slider controls the size of the triangle, demonstrating that while the side lengths change, the sine and cosine ratios for the selected angle remain constant.

interaction_forms.label: Animate Wave Generation
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the play button triggers an animation that traces the unit circle to generate and draw the corresponding sine and cosine wave forms.

interaction_forms.label: Move Point
interaction_forms.description: Dragging a point on the Cartesian plane dynamically updates its Cartesian (x,y) and polar (r, θ) coordinates.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust Radius
interaction_forms.description: A slider adjusts the radius 'r' in the polar coordinate system, which updates the point's position and its Cartesian (x,y) coordinates.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust Theta
interaction_forms.description: A slider adjusts the angle 'θ' in the polar coordinate system, which updates the point's position and its Cartesian (x,y) coordinates.

topic: Parametric and implicit 3D surfaces

interaction_forms.label: Select Surface Type
interaction_forms.description: A dropdown menu selects the type of surface to be rendered, offering options such as paraboloid, saddle, sphere, or torus.

interaction_forms.label: Adjust Surface Parameters
interaction_forms.description: A set of sliders adjusts the coefficients and radii that define the shape of the currently selected surface, updating the visualization in real-time.

interaction_forms.label: Modify Axis Limits
interaction_forms.description: Pairs of number inputs set the visible range (minimum and maximum) for each of the x, y, and z axes.

interaction_forms.label: Manipulate 3D View
interaction_forms.description: The 3D plot can be rotated by clicking and dragging the cursor, changing the camera's viewing angle of the surface.

topic: Natural deduction proofs

interaction_forms.label: Select Task
interaction_forms.description: Clicking a task from the list of logical problems sets up the initial premises and the conclusion to be proven on the workspace.

interaction_forms.label: Add Logic Block
interaction_forms.description: Clicking on a logic rule from the sidebar adds the corresponding block, representing a step of inference, onto the proof canvas.

interaction_forms.label: Connect Blocks
interaction_forms.description: Dragging from an output port of one block to an input port of another creates a wire, representing the flow of a proposition from one proof step to another.

interaction_forms.label: Select Block(s)
interaction_forms.description: Clicking a block selects it for manipulation, and holding shift while clicking allows multiple blocks to be added to the current selection.

interaction_forms.label: Delete Block(s)
interaction_forms.description: Pressing the delete or backspace key removes any currently selected blocks and their connections from the proof canvas.

interaction_forms.label: Create Custom Block
interaction_forms.description: After selecting a group of connected blocks, entering a name and clicking 'Add' combines them into a single, reusable custom block available in the sidebar.

interaction_forms.label: Pan and Zoom
interaction_forms.description: Using the dedicated UI buttons allows the user to zoom in or out on the canvas, which can also be panned by dragging the background.

interaction_forms.label: Undo/Redo
interaction_forms.description: Using the dedicated buttons or keyboard shortcuts reverts the last action or re-applies a previously undone action.

topic: Algorithmic processes for sampling, shuffling, sorting, and maze generation.

interaction_forms.label: Play Algorithm Animation
interaction_forms.description: Clicking a 'Play' button initiates an animation that visually demonstrates the step-by-step process of a specific algorithm, such as placing samples, shuffling or sorting elements, or generating a maze.

interaction_forms.label: Toggle Image Comparison
interaction_forms.description: Holding the mouse button down on algorithmically generated images reveals the original source image underneath, allowing for a direct visual comparison of the sampling quality.

topic: The behavior and interpretation of t-SNE visualizations

interaction_forms.label: Dataset Selection
interaction_forms.description: Selecting a dataset from the dropdown menu resets the visualization with a new initial data structure for the algorithm to process.

interaction_forms.label: Perplexity Control
interaction_forms.description: Adjusting the perplexity slider modifies a key hyperparameter of the t-SNE algorithm, changing the balance between local and global data aspects in the resulting visualization.

interaction_forms.label: Epsilon Control
interaction_forms.description: Modifying the epsilon (learning rate) slider alters the optimization step size, which influences the speed and stability of the algorithm's convergence.

interaction_forms.label: Dataset Parameter Control
interaction_forms.description: When a parametric dataset is chosen, a unique slider appears that allows the user to change a property of the source data itself, such as the number of points in a grid.

interaction_forms.label: Animation Control
interaction_forms.description: Users can play, pause, or restart the iterative optimization process using dedicated buttons, allowing for continuous observation or interruption of the algorithm.

interaction_forms.label: Iteration Scrubber
interaction_forms.description: A slider controlling the current step number allows for manually scrubbing back and forth through the optimization timeline to observe the visualization at any specific iteration.

topic: Execution flow of JavaScript promise chains

interaction_forms.label: Code Input
interaction_forms.description: Editing the JavaScript code dynamically updates the promise chain visualization to match the new logic.

interaction_forms.label: Example Presets
interaction_forms.description: Clicking a preset button loads a specific promise-based code example into the editor and its corresponding visualization.

interaction_forms.label: Promise Trigger
interaction_forms.description: Clicking a promise in the visual chain initiates its asynchronous execution, showing whether it resolves or rejects and how this outcome flows through the connected promises.

interaction_forms.label: Speed Control
interaction_forms.description: Adjusting the speed control changes the playback rate of the promise execution and state transition animations.

topic: Feature extraction for single-stroke character recognition

interaction_forms.label: Drawing Canvas
interaction_forms.description: Drawing a continuous line on a gridded canvas renders the user's stroke.

interaction_forms.label: Quantization Toggling
interaction_forms.description: Clicking buttons toggles a preset curve between its ideal smooth path and its quantized, grid-snapped representation.

interaction_forms.label: Smoothing Demonstration
interaction_forms.description: Selecting different percentage buttons applies varying levels of a smoothing algorithm to a preset quantized curve, altering its final shape.

interaction_forms.label: Smoothing Control
interaction_forms.description: Adjusting a slider transforms a user-drawn stroke by applying a variable smoothing factor, altering its jaggedness in real-time.

interaction_forms.label: Thinning Demonstration
interaction_forms.description: Clicking buttons applies different aggression levels of a thinning algorithm to a preset smoothed curve, showing which data points are kept or discarded.

interaction_forms.label: Thinning Control
interaction_forms.description: Modifying a slider re-processes a user-drawn stroke to discard a variable number of redundant data points based on the size of a "thinning square".

interaction_forms.label: Direction Calculation
interaction_forms.description: Dragging a point relative to a fixed origin displays the calculated cardinal direction based on the aspect ratio of the rectangle connecting the two points.

interaction_forms.label: Curvature Display
interaction_forms.description: Drawing a stroke on a canvas renders the path overlaid with arrows indicating the calculated cardinal direction for each segment.

interaction_forms.label: Curvature Change Display
interaction_forms.description: Drawing on a canvas highlights only the segments where the cardinal direction changes, while graying out redundant directional segments.

interaction_forms.label: Corner Detection Control
interaction_forms.description: Manipulating a slider changes the angle threshold for corner detection, which adds or removes corner markers on a user-drawn stroke.

interaction_forms.label: Stroke Feature Display
interaction_forms.description: Drawing a character on a canvas generates and displays a detailed description of the stroke's features, including its start/end grid positions and corner locations.

interaction_forms.label: Live Recognition Canvas
interaction_forms.description: Drawing a single-stroke character shows a continuously updated list of potential matches and displays the final recognized symbol with a textual justification.

topic: The Bloom filter data structure

interaction_forms.label: Add Key
interaction_forms.description: Typing a string into the first input field and clicking 'Add' computes multiple hash functions, causing the bits at the resulting indices in the vector to become set and highlighted.

interaction_forms.label: Test Key
interaction_forms.description: Typing a string into the second input field computes its hash values, highlights the corresponding bits in the vector, and displays a message indicating if the item is definitely not in the set or probably in the set.

topic: Geometric intersection of multiple circles

interaction_forms.label: Start/Stop Simulation
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'Start' button initiates an animation demonstrating the selected approximation or calculation method for finding the intersection area of the circles.

interaction_forms.label: Select Number of Circles
interaction_forms.description: Clicking on a number from '1 Circle' to '8 Circles' changes the number of circles displayed in the visualization for which the intersection area is being calculated.

interaction_forms.label: Toggle Grid
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'Grid' button toggles the visibility of a background grid in the visualization area.

interaction_forms.label: Randomize Circle Positions
interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'Randomize' button instantly repositions the circles to a new random configuration within the view.

interaction_forms.label: Drag and Move Circles
interaction_forms.description: Dragging any individual circle moves it around the canvas, causing the visualization and the corresponding area calculation to update in real-time.

topic: The Bentley–Ottmann algorithm for finding intersections in a set of line segments.

interaction_forms.label: Move Line
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the endpoints of a line segment moves it, and all intersections are recalculated and displayed in real-time.

interaction_forms.label: Add Point
interaction_forms.description: Clicking anywhere on the canvas adds a new point, and every two points automatically form a new line segment.

interaction_forms.label: Remove Line
interaction_forms.description: Right-clicking on an endpoint of a line segment removes the entire segment from the view.

topic: An algorithm for packing circles into containers

interaction_forms.label: Add/Remove Circles
interaction_forms.description: Clicking within the container adds a circle, while clicking on an existing circle removes it, allowing the user to define the packing problem.

interaction_forms.label: Select Container
interaction_forms.description: The user can cycle through various container shapes, such as squares and triangles, to pack the circles into.

interaction_forms.label: Run Packing Algorithm
interaction_forms.description: Initiating the process animates the execution of the split-packing algorithm, showing how the circles are rearranged to fit.

interaction_forms.label: Reset
interaction_forms.description: A control is available to clear the current state and return the visualization to its initial default configuration.

topic: Data classification methods for choropleth maps

interaction_forms.label: Select Scale Type
interaction_forms.description: Clicking a scale name (Linear, Quantize, Quantile, or Jenks) updates the central code block, the left scatterplot, and the right map to show how each method transforms values into colors.

interaction_forms.label: Select Data Scenario
interaction_forms.description: For the Quantize and Quantile scales, clicking on a specific data scenario text (e.g., 'Outliers compressed') changes the underlying data distribution, which updates the scatterplot and recolors the map to demonstrate the weaknesses of that scale.

topic: Distortion in 2D map projections

interaction_forms.label: Pan Map
interaction_forms.description: Dragging the 2D map projection pans the map and simultaneously rotates the 3D globe to correspond to the new center point.

interaction_forms.label: Zoom Map
interaction_forms.description: Scrolling the mouse wheel over the 2D map projection zooms the map view in or out.

interaction_forms.label: Select Projection
interaction_forms.description: Choosing a map projection from the dropdown menu redraws the 2D map to show how that projection distorts the Earth's surface.

topic: Procedural map generation using cellular automata

interaction_forms.label: Chance to be Filled Slider
interaction_forms.description: Adjusts the probability that a cell is initially 'alive,' which changes the density of the starting grid and reruns the simulation.

interaction_forms.label: Birth Threshold Slider

interaction_forms.label: Image Captioning Attention

topic: Qubit states, superposition, and quantum gates

interaction_forms.description: Clicking the 'Not' button for a specific bit flips its state between 0 and 1, which is shown by moving an indicator to the resulting two-bit state.

interaction_forms.label: Probabilistic NOT gate
interaction_forms.description: Pressing the 'Random NOT' button updates the probabilities of a bit being in state 0 or 1, represented by the changing radii of two state disks.

topic: Programming real-time graphics with fragment shaders

interaction_forms.description: A slider changes the user figurine's altitude, which increases its distance to ground landmarks and causes their corresponding 2D range circles on a map to no longer intersect correctly.
